title: Packers QB Jordan Love to Undergo Thumb Surgery, Expected for Season Opener
snippets: Jordan Love will undergo a procedure to repair a ligament injury to his left thumb, but the Packers expect the star QB to be ready for their season opener.
Love has a ligament issue in his non-throwing hand
The procedure on his non-throwing hand is not expected to keep him out of the season opener, per the team's general manager.
After an injury marred the beginning of his 2024 season, Jordan Love is facing another minor setback.
titles: Packers QB Love to have left thumb procedure
Packers QB Jordan Love will have procedure on left thumb ligament, hopes to return to practice next week
Green Bay Packers QB `Jordan Love, who opens season against Lions, has thumb procedure
Packers QB Jordan Love has thumb procedure, expected to be ready Week 1
summary: Jordan Love, the Packers' quarterback, will have surgery to fix a ligament injury in his left thumb, his non-throwing hand. Despite this setback, the team's general manager has confirmed that Love is expected to recover in time for the season opener. This follows an earlier injury that affected the start of his 2024 season.

title: Trump Extends Tariff Pause on Chinese Imports for 90 Days
snippets: President Trump's executive order extends a reprieve from the threat of rising tariffs between the world's two largest economies.
US president extends deadline on higher Chinese tariffs hours before agreement was due to expire.
U.S., China extend tariff pause another 90 days
President Donald Trump has signed an executive order that will prevent U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods from spiking for another 90 days.
President Trump’s order continues a reprieve from the threat of escalating tariffs and export controls, which rocked the global economy earlier this year.
Trump posted on his Truth Social platform that he signed the executive order for the extension, and that “all other elements of the Agreement will remain the same.”
titles: U.S. and China extend tariff truce deadline for another 3 months
Trump extends China tariff deadline for the second time. What does it mean?
U.S., China extend tariff pause another 90 days - Axios
Trump extends China tariff deadline by 90 days
Trump Extends China Tariff Truce by Three Months
U.S., China extend tariff deadline for 90 days just hours before expiration
summary: President Donald Trump signed an executive order extending the pause on increasing tariffs against Chinese imports for another 90 days, just before the previous pause was set to expire at midnight in Beijing. This action prevents the expected rise in tariffs that was scheduled for Tuesday.

title: Taylor Swift Announces 12th Album "The Life of a Showgirl"
snippets: The Life of a Showgirl revealed as the popstar's latest album after intense speculation from fans.
After a teaser post with a Taylor Swift-shaped silhouette fueled rumors, it was confirmed that the pop star will make her first appearance on the Kelce brothers' podcast.

Singer announced her 12th album at 12.12am on 12 August after a countdown, mysterious posts and teasing an appearance on her boyfriend Travis Kelce’s New Heights podcast

Taylor Swift has announced her next album, The Life of a Showgirl.

Swift is known for dropping hints and clues for
'This is my brand-new album, "The Life of a Showgirl,"' Taylor Swift teased on her boyfriend's podcast as she held up the blurred-out vinyl.
Taylor Swift’s new Spotify playlist features songs all co-created with Max Martin and Shellback, fueling speculation they’re behind her new album The Life of a Showgirl.
titles: Taylor Swift announces new album on boyfriend Travis Kelce's podcast
👀 Taylor Swift teases new album on Kelce pod
Taylor Swift announces new album The Life of a Showgirl
Taylor Swift announces new album, ‘The Life of a Showgirl’
Taylor Swift Shares A Major Hint About Her New Album
summary: Taylor Swift has announced her 12th studio album titled "The Life of a Showgirl," with details and the release date yet to be disclosed. The announcement came after a series of teasers, including a countdown and mysterious posts, culminating in a reveal at 12.12 am on 12 August. Swift also shared a clip from an upcoming appearance on her boyfriend Travis Kelce’s podcast, 'New Heights,' where more information about the album is expected to be unveiled.

title: July Inflation Rises 2.7%, Trump Attributes Success to Policies
snippets: Inflation remained elevated last month as President Trump's tariffs continued to make their way into the prices that consumers pay. The average cost of living in July was up 2.7%.
President slams Goldman Sachs as he hails data as evidence his policies are working
Consumer prices rose 2.7 per cent in July from a year earlier, the Labor Department said Tuesday. Excluding the volatile food and energy categories, core prices rose 3.1 per cent.
titles: Inflation remains elevated as Trump's tariffs take hold
US inflation holds steady at 2.7% in July despite Trump’s tariffs
U.S. inflation holds steady at 2.7% as consumer prices rise
summary: In July, consumer prices increased by 2.7% compared to the previous year, with core prices, excluding food and energy, rising by 3.1%, according to the Labor Department. This inflation rise is partially attributed to the impact of President Trump's tariffs. Despite the elevated inflation, President Trump praised the economic data, suggesting his policies are effective, and criticized Goldman Sachs.

title: Trump Criticizes Fed Chair Powell Over Renovation Costs, Urges Rate Cut
snippets: President Trump blasted Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell over the multi-billion-dollar renovation of the central bank's headquarters.
Trump and his allies have accused the Federal Reserve of mismanaging the reconstruction of its headquarters.
Trump returned to his sharp critiques of the Fed chair, saying "Jerome 'Too Late' Powell must NOW lower the rate" after the inflation report came in a bit cooler than expected.
titles: Trump threatens Fed chair Powell with 'major lawsuit,' demands interest rate cut
Trump Might Greenlight ‘Major Lawsuit’ Against Fed Chair Jerome Powell
Trump threatens legal action against Powell over Fed HQ, demands immediate rate cuts as inflation holds steady
summary: President Trump criticized Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell regarding the costly renovation of the Fed's headquarters, accusing the Federal Reserve of mismanagement. Trump also called for Powell to lower interest rates following a cooler-than-expected inflation report, continuing his pattern of public critiques against the Fed chair.

This move has led to skepticism among some residents about its effectiveness. Current efforts to address these challenges now include increased federal involvement and military presence in the capital.

title: Al Jazeera Reporter and Colleagues Killed in Israeli Airstrike in Gaza
snippets: Prominent reporter Anas al-Sharif and six other journalists were killed when Israel targeted a tent used by media, the broadcaster said.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiggFBVV95cUxOZDVCbzJPY1l5dGFEU2EzaVZQWG42NXJGQldYMGpMeDdXSHB5b2pDS0JjR0VYZHVtM0xuZHpCTHc5ODJrc1VsOGV3U0NWRzFOajFab2VQNlhEMklicDRIc1l0Y1RiTjRPU2haWWtpUndyVDlSZjY1U2tPVFh5SjVJbWN3?oc=5" target="_blank">What to know about the 6 journalists killed coverin
Officials accused Anas al-Sharif of being a Hamas operative posing as a reporter. Al Jazeera says he and the other four victims all worked for the network.
Anas al-Sharif, a well-known correspondent, was among those killed. Israel said it had targeted Mr. al-Sharif, claiming he worked for Hamas, which he had denied.
titles: Who were the Al Jazeera journalists killed by Israel in Gaza?
What to know about the 6 journalists killed covering Israel's war in Gaza - Axios
Who Were the Al Jazeera Journalists Killed in an Israeli Strike in Gaza?
Israeli Strike Kills 5 Al Jazeera Journalists, Network Says
summary: Anas al-Sharif, a 28-year-old Al Jazeera reporter with a significant social media following, and four colleagues were killed in an Israeli airstrike targeting a media tent in northern Gaza. Israel has accused al-Sharif of being a Hamas operative, a claim disputed by Al Jazeera. This incident is part of a broader conflict in which nearly 270 journalists and media workers have been killed since Israel launched its war on Gaza.

title: Spirit Airlines Warns of Uncertain Future Amid Losses
snippets: Spirit AIrlines issued a going-concern warning in its quarterly report.
Spirit Airlines said there was "substantial doubt" about its ability to continue as a going concern, as travel demand has weakened and losses mounted.
“There is substantial doubt as to the Company’s ability to continue as a going concern within 12 months.”
titles: Spirit Airlines warns it might not be able to survive without more cash
Spirit Airlines warns it may not survive another year after huge losses
Spirit Airlines warns it might not be able to survive the next year
summary: Spirit Airlines issued a warning in its quarterly report, expressing "substantial doubt" about its ability to continue operating over the next 12 months due to weakened travel demand and increasing losses. This statement indicates concerns about the airline's future viability.

title: China Hits Canadian Canola with 75.8% Duty, Escalating Trade Tensions
snippets: China escalated trade disputes with Canada on Tuesday by announcing a preliminary anti-dumping duty on Canadian canola imports of more than 75 per cent.

China has announced preliminary tariffs on Canadian canola following an anti-dumping investigation launched last year in response to Canada’s tax on Chinese electric vehicles. Canadian canola exports to China will face a 75.8 per cent duty beginning on Thursday. The move comes nearly a year af
titles: China adds ‘additional pressure’ with new tariffs on Canadian canola
China announces 75.8% tariffs on Canadian canola
summary: China has imposed a preliminary anti-dumping duty of 75.8% on Canadian canola imports, effective Thursday. This action escalates trade tensions between the two nations, following an investigation that China began last year after Canada implemented a tax on Chinese electric vehicles.

title: UFC Plans Fight Night at White House, Awaits Trump's View on Paramount Deal
snippets: UFC CEO Dana White said a fight night at the White House on the Fourth of July next year is "absolutely going to happen."

Hours after Paramount and UFC announced a billion-dollar rights deal, Dana White said he had yet to hear from his friend, President Donald Trump, on his thoughts about the fight company’s new streaming home.

Despite the announcement, White mentioned he had not yet received feedback from President Donald Trump, a friend, about UFC's new streaming partnership with Paramount.

title: Royals Near .500 Despite Witt Jr.'s Efforts, Pitching Strength

Despite Trump's claims of the city being "overtaken" by criminals and gangs, police statistics indicate a significant decrease in violent crimes in recent years. D.C.'s mayor has criticized the comparison to a war-torn country as exaggerated and misleading. Trump's actions are based on invoking section 740 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act.

This declaration was signed by all EU leaders, with the exception of Viktor Orbán, ahead of a call with former President Trump. This move underscores the EU's unified stance on defending Ukraine amidst ongoing conflicts.

Coach Sean McDermott confirmed Cook's participation, signaling a potential progress in his contract standoff.

Trump says he's nominating E.J. Antoni as Bureau of Labor Statistics commissioner
summary: President Donald Trump announced his intention to nominate E.J. Antoni, a chief economist at the conservative Heritage Foundation, as the new commissioner of the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS). This decision follows Trump's firing of the previous commissioner, Erika McEntarfer, citing dissatisfaction with a recent jobs report and accusing her of manipulating data. Trump asserts that Antoni will provide "honest and accurate" employment data.

title: Former Uber Freight CEO Joins Waabi as COO Ahead of Autonomous Truck Launch
snippets: Uber Freight CEO Lior Ron is joining autonomous trucking startup Waabi as COO and says the era of self-driving big rigs across U.S. roads is near.

Self-driving truck maker Waabi has hired autonomous vehicle industry veteran and Uber Freight CEO Lior Ron to step in as chief operating officer, as the startup looks to scale its commercial operations ahead of its planned launch of driverless trucks on public highways later this year.
titles: Uber Freight CEO joins self-driving truck company Waabi, says era of autonomous big rigs on U.S. roads is here
Uber Freight CEO Lior Ron leaves to join self-driving startup Waabi as COO
summary: Lior Ron, previously CEO of Uber Freight, has been appointed as COO of Waabi, an autonomous trucking startup. This move comes as Waabi prepares to launch self-driving trucks on public highways later this year, signaling a significant step towards the commercialization of autonomous big rigs in the U.S.

title: Supreme Court May Revisit Same-Sex Marriage Case, No Decision Yet
snippets: Ten years after the U.S. Supreme Court extended marriage rights to same-sex couples, the justices will consider for the first time whether to take up a case that asks them to overturn that decision.
The court has been asked to reconsider its decision in Obergefell v. Hodges, but there’s so far no indication that they’ll actually hear the case.
titles: WATCH:  Supreme Court formally asked to overturn landmark same-sex marriage ruling
Will The Supreme Court Overturn Same-Sex Marriage? Maybe—But It Hasn’t Done Anything Yet.
summary: A decade after the U.S. Supreme Court granted marriage rights to same-sex couples in Obergefell v. Hodges, the Court may consider a case seeking to overturn this decision. However, there is currently no indication that the justices will agree to hear the case.

title: Study: Full-Time Work Post-Retirement Boosts Well-being, Varies by Gender
snippets: Having a full-time job in later life has been linked to improved emotional, financial and general life satisfaction - but the results vary a lot between men and women

Work can be a boon or a burden, depending on who you ask. For many, the thought of having nothing to fill their days after retirement is distressing, while others might look forward to filling their days with all the activities they never had time for before. But what is the reality of life after re
titles: Working past the age of retirement may improve your life satisfaction
Working after retirement associated with higher life satisfaction—especially for men
summary: Research indicates that maintaining a full-time job in later life can lead to better emotional, financial, and overall life satisfaction. However, the impact varies significantly between men and women. While some individuals view post-retirement work positively, seeing it as a way to stay active and engaged, others anticipate retirement as a time for leisure and personal pursuits. The study highlights the diverse perspectives on work and retirement and their effects on well-being.

title: Weaver Ants Work Harder in Larger Groups, Study Finds
snippets: Weaver ants have solved a problem that has plagued human teams for centuries: individuals contribute less to tasks when more people join in. New research published in Current Biology on 12 August shows individual weaver ants instead get stronger as their group grows.
titles: Weaver ants reveal secrets of superefficient teamwork for robot design
summary: New research published in Current Biology on August 12 reveals that unlike humans, who tend to contribute less to tasks in larger groups, individual weaver ants increase their effort as their group size grows. This finding challenges long-held beliefs about group dynamics and could have implications for understanding social behavior and teamwork in species beyond humans.

title: Finnish Study Finds Lignin Effective Against Viruses, Bacteria

The results highlight that lignin, which is also an important byproduct of the wood industry, h
titles: Wood industry byproduct lignin found effective against viruses and bacteria
summary: Research from the University of Jyväskylä's Nanoscience Center in Finland has discovered that lignin, a significant plant structure component and wood industry byproduct, possesses antimicrobial properties effective against viruses and bacteria. This finding could have implications for its use in enhancing antimicrobial applications.

title: Prince Rupert's Legacy: Naming of Bay and Land in 1670

title: NASA's Curiosity Rover Gets Upgrade for Better Mars Navigation

summary: NASA's Curiosity Mars Rover has received a significant software upgrade to enhance its autonomous capabilities, allowing it to navigate the Martian terrain more efficiently. This update improves the rover's ability to identify and avoid potential hazards on its own, thereby increasing its operational safety and efficiency in exploring the Martian surface.
